summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019, forwarding a media inquiry from a Washington Post reporter to the FBI's Office of Public Affairs. The reporter, Deanna Paul, seeks background on the challenges of investigating sex trafficking cases, specifically mentioning cases where the line between victim and subject is blurred, in the context of the Epstein case.

persons.name: Deanna Paul
persons.context: A reporter for the Washington Post who contacted the FBI seeking background information on the challenges of working sex trafficking cases, particularly where the victim/subject line is blurred. She is a former Assistant District Attorney in Brooklyn.

persons.name: Martin R. Feely
persons.context: An FBI employee in the Office of Public Affairs (NY) who is copied on the email regarding the media inquiry from reporter Deanna Paul.

persons.name: Adrienne L. Senatore
persons.context: An FBI employee in the Office of Public Affairs (NY) who is copied on the email regarding the media inquiry from reporter Deanna Paul.

connections.description: Deanna Paul, a reporter, is seeking to be connected through Feely for background information from the FBI.
Deanna Paul, a reporter, is seeking to be connected through Senatore for background information from the FBI.

events.title: Media Inquiry to FBI Regarding Sex Trafficking Cases
events.description: Washington Post reporter Deanna Paul contacts the FBI's New York office seeking background information on the challenges of investigating sex trafficking cases, explicitly in the context of the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email from August 2019, showing media interest in the Epstein case shortly after his death.

Reporter Deanna Paul's inquiry specifically seeks FBI background on the challenges of sex trafficking investigations where 'the line between victim and subject may be blurred,' a direct reference to complexities in the Epstein case.
The email reveals the FBI's Office of Public Affairs in New York was the point of contact for handling this sensitive media inquiry related to an ongoing high-profile investigation.
The reporter, Deanna Paul, is noted as a former Assistant District Attorney in Brooklyn who had previously worked with the FBI and NYPD SVU on a case involving sexual abuse of minors.
